original_title: Sri Lanka sells mostly 6-month bills at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s 3 and 6-month Treasuries yields edged lower at this week’s auction with all offered volumes sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 33 billion rupees 3-month bills at 14.51 percent percent, down 06 basis points from a week earlier after offering 27.5 billion rupees.
42.9 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 14.16 percent, down 08 basis points after offering 25 billion rupees.
Only 732 billion rupees of 12 month bills were sold at 12.93 percent, unchanged from a week ago, after offering 25 billion rupees. (Colombo/Dec27/2023)
